page.title: 14Dry Stone Walls
page.content: In this area there are many miles of dry stone walls.My grandad, John Reeves, is a dry stone wall builder. This is how he repairs a wall: The wall is marked out with a guide line. On the outside faces a layer of thick stones is placed down. It is important that these stones are of equal thickness.The space between the large stones is filled with small stones. The line is then raised 7 cm more and a thinner layer of stones is placed down. Care has to be taken so that the stones do not wobble. The string is raised once more and a thick layer of stones laid. This process is repeated until the wall is the correct height. Some walls are finished with stones placed on their edge. John will complete two yards of wall a day.
